subject: RE: [junit] Automatic JUnit test creation
msgSnippet: Oops, bad attribution.  Calvin was the one proposing a tool to write my unit tests for me. Todd. ________________________________ From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
Oops, bad attribution. Calvin was the one proposing a tool to write my
unit tests for me.


Todd.


________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Bradley, Todd
Sent: Tuesday, August 02, 2005 8:44 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Automatic JUnit test creation


Not everyone uses JUnit for TDD, I suppose.

Nowadays that I think in TDD, I can barely imagine a tool to
write my
unit tests for me, any more than I can imagine a tool that will
write my
code for me.

Hmm. Actually, now that I think about it, having a tool that
writes my
code for me in order to make my TDD unit tests pass seems MORE
feasible
than what Chris is proposing.


Todd.




________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]
On
Behalf Of Chris Dollin
Sent: Tuesday, August 02, 2005 2:06 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Automatic JUnit test creation


On Tuesday 02 August 2005 00:12, Calvin Austin wrote:
> Wouldn't it be nice if Junit could do all the hard work
and
create the
> tests for you?

I don't see how it could - when I start writing tests,
there is
no code for anything to create tests /from/.

What am I missing?

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
predicting self-predictors' predictions is predictably
unpredictable.
